text: Nick Grouf is an American entrepreneur and philanthropist. He is described as a "pioneer of the Web 1.0 generation". He is the co-founder and managing director of Alpha Edison√†, and the founder of Clementine Capital, LLC. == Biography == Grouf was born and raised up in New York City. He attended the Horace Mann School. He graduated with a degree in American Studies in 1990; his senior thesis, an opera, won Yale's Norman Holmes Pearson Prize. == References == Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Yale University alumni Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Philanthropists from New York (state)
title: Nick Grouf
